index.pageTitle: Register to have your say about a national infrastructure project - National Infrastructure Planning
index.pageHeading: Register to have your say about a national infrastructure project

open.heading1: You are registering to have your say about the {{-project}}
open.paragraph1: Use this service to have your say about a national infrastructure project. We need your personal details and your comments about the {{-project}}.
open.paragraph2: You must include comments with your registration. Your comments must be about what you consider to be the main issues and impacts. You should include as much detail as possible and cover anything that may affect your day-to-day life.
open.paragraph4: You will be able to submit further comments during the examination of the application once you have registered.
open.paragraph5: You must submit your registration before 23:59 on {{-date}}.
open.heading4: If you are registering yourself as an individual
open.heading5: If you are registering for an organisation you work or volunteer for
open.listItem8: the name of the charity or organisation you work for
open.heading6: If you are registering on behalf of another person or organisation
open.listItem14: your email address and telephone number
open.listItem15: the details of the person, household or organisation you are representing
open.listItem16: their registration comments about the project

closed.paragraph1: The time period to register to have your say has closed.

registerFor.pageTitle: Who are you registering for - Register to have your say about a national infrastructure project -  National Infrastructure Planning
registerFor.option2: An organisation I work or volunteer for
registerFor.option3: On behalf of another person, a household or an organisation I do not work for

whoRegisteringFor.agent: Registering on behalf of someone else

whoRepresenting.option2: An organisation or charity I do not work for

name.hint:
We will publish this on the website along with your comments about the project.

You must register as an individual. If your partner wants to register, they will have to fill in a separate form with their details.

areYou18.hint: You can still register to have your say if you are under 18, but we will process your personal details in a different way.

areThey18.hint: You can still register for them if they are under 18, but we will process their personal details in a different way.

email.hint: We will use your email address to send you information about this project. We will not publish your email address.

theirEmail.hint: We will not contact anyone using these contact details.

theirAddress.hint: We will not contact anyone using these contact details.

number.hint: We will use your phone number to contact you about the project if we cannot reach you by email. We will not publish your telephone number.

theirNumber.hint: We will not contact anyone using these contact details.

aboutProject.pageHeading: What do you want to tell us about this proposed project?
aboutProject.paragraph1: You must include comments with your registration. Your comments must be about what you consider to be the main issues and impacts. You should include as much detail as possible and cover anything that may affect your day-to-day life.
aboutProject.paragraph3: You will be able to submit further comments during the examination of the application once you have registered

details.heading1: Use of language, hyperlinks and sensitive information
details.paragraph1: You should not use racist, inflammatory or abusive language, or include sensitive information (also called special category information) about yourself or others in your comments.
details.paragraph2: Do not include links to third party websites. You can include links to either GOV.UK or websites for chartered professional institutes like IEMA.
details.paragraph4: It also means any information relating to an individual's:

checkYourAnswers.agent: On behalf of another person, a household or an organisation I do not work for

declaration.paragraph1: By submitting this form, you are registering to have your say and telling us your registration comments.
declaration.paragraph2: The Examining Authority must consider your views when they recommend if the project should go ahead. We will contact you if we need more information about the comments you provided in the registration form.
declaration.paragraph3: You are agreeing that we will use your details to:
declaration.listItem1: contact you about the project or if we need more information
declaration.listItem2: let you know when you can submit more information
declaration.paragraph4: You are also agreeing that all comments you submit, along with your name, will be published on this website. No contact details will be made public.
declaration.paragraph5: Once we publish your comments, they cannot be removed from the website. You can withdraw your registration comments from the examination of the project and they will no longer be taken into account.

complete.paragraph1: We have received your registration. Make a note of your reference number.
complete.paragraph2: We will contact you if we need more information about the comments you provided in the registration form.
complete.heading1: Getting involved in the preliminary meeting
complete.paragraph3: After the registration period has closed, you will be sent a letter called the rule 6 letter, telling you when and where the preliminary meeting will be held. This is to talk about how the application will be examined. It will also include a draft timetable for the examination of the application.
complete.heading2: How and when to submit more information
complete.paragraph4: We will let you know when the examination of this application starts.
complete.paragraph5: You can submit more information by completing the form on the project page. You will need your interested party reference number to make sure your comments are included in the examination of the application.
complete.paragraph6: You can check our guide to {{-link}}
complete.paragraph6LinkText: find out more about having your say during the examination of the application (opens in new tab)
complete.paragraph7LinkText: Go back to the project page
complete.paragraph8LinkText: Tell us what you thought about this service

organisationName.empty: Enter the name of the organisation you work for
organisationName.length: The name of the organisation you work for must be 255 characters or less

organisationOrCharityName.empty: Enter your organisation or charity name
organisationOrCharityName.length: Name of your organisation or charity name must be 255 characters or less

jobTitleOrRole.empty: Enter your job title or volunteer role
jobTitleOrRole.length: Your job title or volunteer role must be 64 characters or less

namePersonRepresenting.empty: Enter the full name of the person you are representing
namePersonRepresenting.length: Full name of the person you are representing must be between 3 and 64 characters

nameOrganisationRepresenting.empty: Enter the full name of the organisation you are representing
nameOrganisationRepresenting.length: Full name of the organisation you are representing must be between 3 and 64 characters

nameHouseholdRepresenting.empty: Enter the name of the household you are representing
nameHouseholdRepresenting.length: Full name of the household you are representing must be between 3 and 64 characters

areThey18.empty: Select yes if they are 18 or over

theirTelephoneNumber.length: Telephone number must be 255 characters or less
theirTelephoneNumber.format: Enter a telephone number, like 01632 960 001, 07700 900 982 or 44 808 157 0192

theirEmailAddress.length: Email address must be between 3 and 255 characters
theirEmailAddress.format: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com
